page.title: 13CROOKES, SHEFFIELD, 1985
page.content: Crookes is one of the districts of Sheffield. The{buildings,}which are mainly houses, are built of stone and brick with welsh slate roofs. A lot are now in need of repair. Crookes is quite close to the city centre and is also a good, modern, shopping centre. It has its own{schools, churches, {public houses}and{cemeteries.}A supermarket is now standing where the old Crookes picture palace used to be. Although the{streets and roads}are now tarmac covered, in places where the tarmac has worn away you can still see the original cobblestones. One of the local schools was called Crookes Endowed, it has now closed and been converted into a{community centre which is used for a variety of activities. Crookes is a very busy area with lots of traffic going up and down.
